abstract: The Treasury is withholding payments from Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo because of their performance in modifying loans for homeowners.
snippet: The Treasury is withholding payments from Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo because of their performance in modifying loans for homeowners.
lead_paragraph: As the nation’s housing market continues to teeter, the Treasury Department on Thursday penalized three of the nation’s largest banks for subpar performance in administrating a government-sponsored program to modify mortgage loans for distressed homeowners.

headline.main: Big Banks Penalized for Performance in Mortgage Modification Program
headline.print_headline: Big Banks Penalized for Performance In Mortgage Modification Program
